name: BOBET Bottecchia 1951 merino jersey
description: Perfect replica of the jersey used by Louison Bobet to win the “Sanremo” in 1951, made with same material and production techniques. Featuring tubular, 100% Merino Wool construction, original Cornely embroidered logos made with handoperated machines, classic shirt collar with hand reinforced stitches and 5 pockets with genuine mother of pearl buttons. Strictly limited to 51 pieces worldwide in a special gift set box with an exclusive, hand painted, die cast Bobet mini figure. Made in Italy. Individually Certified and numbered 1 to 51. See size chart Free worldwide delivery

name: Cinelli 1970 Cycling Jersey
description: Cinelli's Antonio Colombo commissioned De Marchi to recreate this iconic Cinelli jersey. Originally created for Cinelli's Milano laboratorio and shop at 45 Via Egidio Folli on the eastern outskirts of Milano, the Cinelli jersey was exported worldwide to accompany the beautiful bicycles and classic Cinelli accessories that were cherished by bicycle aficionados around the globe. Doug Dale, a well-known American racer in the 1960's and '70's lent us his original jersey for the replica, one that he obtained from the legendary Kopp's Cycles in Princeton, New Jersey USA. Authorized replica of original 1970's Cinelli jersey. Made of functional and beautiful Merino wool blend for classic performance and easy care, our Cinelli jersey replica features the original zippered collar, 2 front and 3 rear pockets with Mother of pearl buttons. Original Cornely-type embroidered logos. Slim fit. Made in Italy from 100% Italian materials. See size chart Free worldwide delivery

name: Filotex 1975 Moser merino jersey
description: Our authentic reproduction of this 1975 Filotex jersey is a homage to young Francesco Moser. Nicknamed "The Sheriff", Moser burst onto the pro cycling scene as a neo-pro in 1973 with the Filotex team, a small Italian pro outfit that sourced their team jerseys from Maglificio Sportivo De Marchi. By 1975, Moser was beloved by the Italian cycling public for his attacking style after winning17 races in the previous season. Our authentic Filotex replica is the same as Moser wore in his first two and a half pro seasons until he won the Italian Championship in June 1975. We use a itch-free Merino wool blend for easy care, classic mother-of-pearl buttoned pockets with reinforced stitching, logos in Cornely-type hand cranked embroidery and doubled cuffs. Handmade in Italy by De Marchi, like back in the day. See size chart Free worldwide delivery

name: Salvarani 1972 Gimondi Jersey
description: Italian fitted kitchen manufacturer Salvarani struck gold when they brought 1964 Tour de l'Avenir winner Felice Gimondi into the pro ranks in 1965. Gimondi stayed with Salvarani for eight seasons, winning the Tour de France, Giro d'Italia, Italian championship and Paris-Roubaix, becoming a prolific winner with 99 pro victories while lad in the "azzuro chiaro" kit of Salvarani. Our Felice Gimondi Salvarani Jersey is an authentic reproduction of the jersey originally made by De Marchi in 1972. We use a itch-free Merino wool blend for easy care, classic mother-of-pearl buttoned pockets with reinforced stitching, logos in Cornely-type hand cranked embroidery and doubled cuffs. Handmade in Italy by De Marchi, like back in the day. See size chart Free worldwide delivery.

name: Wilier Triestina 1951 Bevilacqua Jersey
description: Toni Bevilacqua was a powerful track pursuit rider from Mestre who also excelled at road racing. During his exceptional 17 year pro career, Bevilacqua ran for teams like Lygie, Wilier Triestina and Atala so he was on a first-name basis with De Marchi founder Emilio De Marchi, who considered Toni a close friend. During the 1950 season, Bevilacqua returned to the Wilier Triestina where he became World Pursuit champion in Rocourt, Belgium. Bevilacqua won two stages of the Giro d'Italia in May, then exchanged his bordeaux Wilier Triestina for the Maglia Tricolore of Italian Champion in June of '50. Our Toni Bevilacqua Wilier Triestina Jersey is an authentic reproduction of the jersey originally made by De Marchi in 1950. We use a itch-free Merino wool blend for easy care, classic mother-of-pearl buttoned pockets with reinforced stitching, logos in Cornely-type hand cranked embroidery and doubled cuffs. Handmade in Italy by De Marchi, like back in the day. See size chart Free worldwide delivery.

name: Atala 1949 Pezzi Jersey
description: Although Luciano Pezzi only took three pro wins in his 13 pro seasons, the lanky climber from Russi (Emilia-Romagna) was much valued as a "gregario" or helper. His tactical nous and cycling acumen served him well as Pezzi road for team leaders like Fausto Coppi, Gino Bartali and Gastone Nencini. Back in '49, Atala's leader was Emilio De Marchi's friend Toni Bevilacqua, who wore the distinctive great and blue stripe jersey of Cesere Rizzato's Atala bicycle marque. Pezzi went on to a distinguished career as a direttore sportivo, where he guided Felice Gimondi to his Tour de France win and eventually working with Marco Pantani at Mercatone Uno. Our Atala Luciano Pezzi Jersey is an authentic reproduction of the jersey originally made by De Marchi in 1949. We use a itch-free Merino wool blend for easy care, classic mother-of-pearl buttoned pockets with reinforced stitching, logos in Cornely-type hand cranked embroidery and doubled cuffs. Handmade in Italy by De Marchi, like back in the day. See size chart Free worldwide delivery.

name: Mainetti 1967 M. Basso Jersey
description: In 1966, local Italian hanger manufacturer and cycling fan Mario Mainetti started a pro cycling team to promote his company and struck gold with 21 year old sprinter Marino Basso, who won a stage in the Giro d'Italia and was second twice. In '67, Basso got even faster and made his Tour de France debut for Gruppo Sportivo Mainetti, winning two stages there. Big-time outfit Molteni snapped up Basso for '68 and Sig. Mainetti folded G.S. Mainetti to focus on the newly constructed Veldromo Mainetti in Castelgomberto, Italy. Our Marino Basso Mainetti Jersey is an authentic reproduction of the jersey originally made by De Marchi in 1966-67. We use a itch-free Merino wool blend for easy care, classic mother-of-pearl buttoned pockets with reinforced stitching, logos in Cornely-type hand cranked embroidery and doubled cuffs. Handmade in Italy by De Marchi, like back in the day. See size chart Free worldwide delivery.

name: Scic 1969 Adorni Jersey
description: Inspired by the success of competitor Salvarani in cycling, Renzo Fornari started his fitted-kitchen sponsored team SCIC (Super Cucine Italiane Componibili) in 1969 with newly minted World Champion Vittorio Adorni. Managed by Ercole Baldini, 1970 was a "tornee' d'addio" victory lap for the popular Adorni in his final year in pro cycling. Adorni's SCIC teammates that season included sprinters Luciano Armani and Adriano Durante. Adorno wore this jersey in the second part of the season as he started 1970 clad in the the Maglia Tricolore of Italian champion. Our SCIC Vittorio Adorni Jersey is an authentic reproduction of the jersey originally made by De Marchi in 1969-70. We use a itch-free Merino wool blend for easy care, classic mother-of-pearl buttoned pockets with reinforced stitching, logos in Cornely-type hand cranked embroidery and doubled cuffs. Handmade in Italy by De Marchi, like back in the day. See size chart Free worldwide delivery.

name: Italia 1947 Merino Cycling Jersey
description: In 1947 among the ruins of post-WW2 Italy, there were few cycling jersey manufacturers. The Italian Cycling Federation came to De Marchi founder Emilio De Marchi, who's Maglificio Sportivo De Marchi was producing cycling jerseys for squadre professionistiche and dilettanti in the Veneto region of Italy. Top grade wool was hard to come by in those post-war days but De Marchi had located a source in Biella from a wool mill called Zegna. The '47 championships were run in Reims, France on Sunday, August 3, 1947, a brutally hot day where only 7 riders finished the race, including Fiorenzo Magni of Italy, who was 4th. Our Fiorenzo Magni Italia Squadra Nazionale Cycling Jersey is an authentic reproduction of the jersey originally made by De Marchi in 1947. We use a itch-free Merino wool blend for easy care, classic mother-of-pearl buttoned pockets with reinforced stitching, logos in Cornely-type hand cranked embroidery and doubled cuffs. Handmade in Italy by De Marchi, like back in the day. See size chart Free worldwide delivery.

name: Belgium 1974 Merino Cycling Jersey
description: It was a beautiful day on Sunday, August 25, 1974 for the World Pro Cycling Championships in Montreal, Canada, raced on 21 laps of a tough 12.5km circuit. France brought their A game, riding an almost perfect tactical race with attacks by Francis Campaner and Bernard Thévenet, except for one thing: Eddy Merckx and his Belgian team. In a rematch of that years Tour de France, Merckx beat 38 year old Raymond Poulidor in a two-up sprint. Thévenet was on a great day, with a solo break of almost 100km, but was caught and dropped by a small group on the last ascent of Mount Royal. It was Merckx's swan song, his third world championship, which only Italian Alfredo Binda and fellow Belgian Rik van Steenbergen had done before, and only Óscar Freire had achieved after Merckx. Our Belgian National Team Jersey is an authentic reproduction of the jersey originally worn by Eddy Merckx. We use a itch-free Merino wool blend for easy care, classic mother-of-pearl buttoned pockets with reinforced stitching, logos in Cornely-type hand cranked embroidery and doubled cuffs. Handmade in Italy by De Marchi, like back in the day. See size chart Free worldwide delivery

name: France 1954 Merino Cycling Jersey
description: On a cold and rainy Sunday on August 22, 1954, the World Pro Road championships were run over 16 laps of 15km for a total of 240 km on the hilly Klingenring circuit near Solingen, Germany. France's team leader Louison Bobet was wearing a jersey made for him by De Marchi founder Emilio De Marchi at his Maglificio Sportivo De Marchi. Bobet punctured with 10 km to go, but got a quick wheel change, caught leader Fritz Schaer of Switzerland and soloed to victory. Our French National Team Jersey is an authentic reproduction of the jersey originally worn by Louison Bobet. We use a itch-free Merino wool blend for easy care, classic mother-of-pearl buttoned pockets with reinforced stitching, logos in Cornely-type hand cranked embroidery and doubled cuffs. Handmade in Italy by De Marchi, like back in the day.  See size chart Free worldwide delivery.

name: Ireland 1982 Merino Cycling Jersey
description: After 18 laps of 15km on the Goodwood Motor Racing Circuit in Sussex, England on September 5, 1982, Ireland's Sean Kelly finished third in the World Pro Road Championships, behind Giuseppe Saronni of Italy and Greg Lemond of the USA, a disappointing result for the Irishman from Carrick-on-Suir. It was Kelly's first medal in the World Championship, a race that illuded him throughout his illustrious 17 year pro career. Kelly was also 3rd in the 1989 World Championship Road Race and 5th in the World Championship Road Race three times: 1986, 1987, and 1990. Our Ireland National Team Jersey is an authentic reproduction of the jersey originally worn by Sean Kelly. We use a itch-free Merino wool blend for easy care, classic mother-of-pearl buttoned pockets with reinforced stitching, logos in Cornely-type hand cranked embroidery and doubled cuffs. Handmade in Italy by De Marchi, like back in the day. See size chart Free worldwide delivery.

We use a itch-free Merino wool blend for easy care, classic mother-of-pearl buttoned pockets with reinforced stitching, logos in Cornely-type hand cranked embroidery and doubled cuffs. Handmade in Italy by De Marchi, like back in the day. See size chart Free worldwide delivery

name: Cycling Leather Mitts
description: One of the coolest and at same time most versatile piece in our line, the classic leather mitts don’t accept compromises in term of quality: only the softest hair sheep leather has been used on these England-made masterpieces. Free worldwide delivery.

name: Loden Cycling Cap
description: A perfect example of design contamination, the Loden Cap reinterprets a classic cycling design with a twist of authentic Moessman wool, the indisputed king of Austrian Lodens. Free worldwide delivery.

name: Silk foulard
description:
Maybe not a windproof as laminated mambrane, certainly many times cooler, this 100% pure silk foulard is entirely made in Italy with natural, water-based polka dot print. The perfect complement for a classic cycling look.

Available in black or white. 

Free worldwide delivery
